text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
basic vanilla sugar cookie recipe and
tutorial I'm going to be showing you my
absolute favorite vanilla sugar cookie
recipe perfect for decorated cookies if
you're not already subscribed to my
channel my cupcake addiction make sure
you do so you don't miss any of these
fabulous upcoming sugar cookie tutorials
the things that you'll need for today's
recipe I've got some castor sugar or
superfine sugar a large egg a little bit
of plain flour some baking powder I'm
using some good quality vanilla extract
I've got two spoons and a spatula I've
got some more plain flour sifted in my
bowl and I've got some butter in my
mixing bowl I'm using a whisk attachment
mixer and I'm lucky enough to have a
rotating bowled today you'll also need
to have your oven preheated as per the
recipe below you'll need a cookie tray
lined with greaseproof paper you'll need
a cooling rack a rolling pin and just an
offset spatula or something like a sharp
knife that you can use to get under your
cookies with I'll leave all of the
recipe quantities measurements and
conversions in the description box below
and if you're looking for the full
method and recipe so you guys can print
it out and keep it at home head on over
to the Microtech addiction blog if
you're not already following the blog
it's my cupcake addiction blog calm the
first thing that you want to do is you
want to take your baking powder and
we're just going to stir this in through
our sifted plain flour this is going to
give you cookies a little bit of rise
but not so much that they spread then
you want to take your caster sugar and
tip it into that mixer we're going to
turn those beaters on we're going to
whip that till it's really really light
and fluffy make sure you scrape down the
sides of your bowl using a spatula so
that you don't end up with any under
creamed butter sugar mixture and what
you're looking for is this really nice
lightening in color that you can see so
it's really lined up from that yellowy
butter it's a lot lighter and fluffier
now you want to take your egg and you
just want to tip that in you want to
beat this once again until that eggs
fully combined and your mixture is still
beautiful and light and fluffy perfect
now you want to add in your flour about
a third of the flour goes in at this
point so I'm just going to use my cup
measure just to scoop in roughly 1/3 of
that flour and then you want to start
your mixer at a really low speed once
your third of your flowers being
combined add in your second third and I
only add in about two thirds of flour
this way and then the last bit of flour
I do it by hand just because it's not as
hard on my mixer that way so you can see
here it's really still kind of quite
lumpy and chunky so lift up your mixer
which will be working quite hard add in
your vanilla essence at this point so
just a good teaspoon of vanilla or
whatever flavoring you've decided to
flavor your sugar cookies with and just
mix that through you can also add your
flavoring at the stage but you're
creaming your butter in your sugar if
you like tip in your remaining flour and
I'm just going to use my spatula or a
wooden spoon just to mix that through
nicely and once you're happy that it's
all relatively combined so you can't see
any more of that white flour you want to
take your bowl and we're just going to
dump that out onto the bench so tube it
out it's going to still look really
quite crumbly this is where your hands
come in so you want to need that for two
to three minutes and you want to take it
from that kind of crumbly flour mix you
can see here it's really coming together
to form a nice dough like ball once
you're happy that you've got this kind
of doughy consistency
shape it into a really nice smooth ball
and then we're going to wrap it
completely in cling film so that it's
completely airtight so whatever plastic
wrap you've got just make sure that it's
airtight before we pop that off into the
fridge you want to let this set for
between one hour to 6 hours is ideal
before you use it you can leave that in
the fridge for up to three days and it
also freezes really well so when it
comes out of the fridge you just want to
unwrap it and I just like to work with
about a third of mine at a time
once you need this down you're going to
see it really crumble up again because
it's going to be quite firm this has
actually been in the fridge for about 12
hours this particular recipe so you'll
see it crumble down don't panic here
because once again the warmth of your
hands is going to bring it back together
it will still be chilly though so don't
be tempted to over knead it you just
want it to get back to this nice
workable consistency the reason I only
work with one third of my mixer at a
time is because once that dough starts
to warm up too much you need to sit it
back in the fridge for another hour or
two
to get it back to its chilled
consistency to work with so working with
the third means your other dough's still
cold and you can bring it out and work
with that once you're finished with this
first lot sprinkle down a really
generous amount of that spare flour that
you had as well as on top of the dough
and just use your roller just to roll it
out so you can see how well it's rolling
but I'm also keeping it moving so that
it doesn't stick to the bench and so
that I get a really nice even thickness
that's about the thickness I like to go
with for my cookie dough take your
cookie cutters now and just cut your
shapes you'll notice I give them a
little jiggle back and forth and that's
just to get a really nice clean cut
around the edges the amount of flour
we've put down on that bench should mean
that your cookie shapes just come off
that map really nicely you want to fill
your tray and make sure that you're
using all of your available cookie dough
here so you'll see I'm using all of the
little scrappy pieces as much as I can
use with that cookie cutter shape pop
those off into the oven and they're
going to cook really quickly like seven
to ten minutes you'll know they're done
when they just turn golden brown around
the edges just be careful with them as
you're transferring them from your
cookie tray onto your cooling rack
because they're quite fragile when they
just baked I'll be showing you how to
decorate these as these little princess
crowns coming up shortly but stay tuned
to the micro cake addiction channel
because I've got lots more great ideas
and uses for this absolutely delicious
cookie recipe thanks very much for
watching
